alert.note: Alert for Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 27 at 4:49AM EST until December 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Rowan. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 447 AM EST, Stream gauges reported minor flooding along North Second Creek near Woodleaf due runoff from the recent heavy rainfall. This runoff will keep stream levels elevated this morning. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Flooding is most likely to affect the vicinity of North Second Creek south of Woodleaf. Low water crossings may be affected on White Road, Lyerly Road, Upright Road, Graham Road, Childers Road, and Bear Poplar Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
